April 2025 County of Marin EMS C 7
NARROW COMPLEX TACHYCARDIA
Indications
• QRS <0.12 sec. documented rhythm in 2 leads
• Includes Atrial Fibrillation, Atrial Flutter, and SVT (regular HR >150 bpm)
Unstable?
No Yes
Signs of poor perfusion:
• Decreased LOC
• SBP <100
• CHF, CP, SOB
ALS RMC ALS RMC
Proximal vein is preferred IV site Proximal vein is preferred IV site
Stable Atrial Fibrillation Stable SVT Unstable SVT/A-Fib/A-
and Atrial Flutter flutter
• Obtain 12-lead EKG
Obtain 12-lead EKG • Consider valsalva • If patient is conscious,
maneuver consider sedation with
• If no response to valsalva: Midazolam 1mg IV/IO
• Adenosine 6mg RAPID slowly (use with caution
IVP followed by 20ml if patient is hypotensive)
NS flush • Synchronized
• If no response after 1-2 cardioversion at 100J,
min:
200J, 300J, 360J
• Adenosine 12mg • If any delay in
RAPID IVP followed by synchronized
20ml NS flush cardioversion and the
• Elevate the extremity after patient is critical,
each bolus
defibrillate the patient
